intro: Melampyrum dinaricum, commonly known as the Dinaric touch-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are alternate and lanceolate, often with a distinctive waxy coating. The species is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
